intro: Leptocarpus laxus, commonly known as the slender sea siphon, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of eastern Australia. It is a member of the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale blue to violet flowers, which are often borne on slender, hairy stalks. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils along the shorelines and is adapted to withstand salt spray and wind. Leptocarpus laxus is an important component of coastal vegetation, providing habitat for various invertebrates and birds.
